show.title: Enter the Clones of Bruce
show.headline: The death of Bruce Lee gave birth to a new film subgenre: Bruceploitation

event.title: <show-title>Enter the Clones of Bruce</show-title> <event-type-title>w/Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: See the hard-hitting kung fu doc with a real-life Bruce clone
event.description: After becoming an international martial arts sensation, the death of Bruce Lee left a dragon-sized hole in cinema that was impossible to fill ‚Äì not that people didn‚Äôt try. Whether you prefer Bruce Li, Dragon Lee, or Bruce Liang, there‚Äôs a clone for you. ENTER THE CLONES OF BRUCE is a love letter to the original icon, the badass actors tasked with filling his shoes, and the cinematic awesomeness that is kung fu movies. Our friends at Fantastic Fest will be taking it on tour with one of the most prolific Bruce clones, Bruce Le, joining us along the way for live Q&As.

event.title: <show-title>Pulp Fiction</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Do the twist at our PULP FICTION Movie Party
event.description:
PULP FICTION shook audiences around the world when it first arrived 30 years ago, lifting elements from a wide array of time-worn stories and weaving them together into something truly new. Considering its impact on film history and just how damn watchable it is, any time is a great time to celebrate this iconic achievement.

When you arrive, we'll provide you with an ‚Äúadrenaline‚Äù shot pen in case you need a shot to the heart, candy cigarettes (just pretend they're Red Apple band), and a yellow coffee mug so you can enjoy some "serious gourmet sh*t" just like Jules.

So don‚Äôt be a square, daddio. Grab your honey bunny and cruise on down to the most fun, most bloody, most groovy Movie Party in town.

show.title: The Big Lebowski
show.headline: The Coen Bros.' slacker odyssey really ties the room together

event.title: <show-title>The Big Lebowski</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: It's the greatest movie party ever, but that's just like, uh, our opinion, man
event.description:
You want a movie party? We can get you a movie party, believe me. There are ways, Dude. You don't wanna know about it, believe me.

With its endlessly quotable dialogue, twist-filled mystery, and iconic characters, THE BIG LEBOWSKI has become a fixture of modern pop culture. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre putting together a movie party to celebrate the greatness that is El Duderino (we‚Äôre not into the whole ‚Äúbrevity‚Äù thing).

When you arrive, we‚Äôll provide you with a bowling pin keychain to commemorate the forever-two-steps-behind Donny Kerabatsos, glow sticks that‚Äôll make you feel like you‚Äôre a part of The Dude‚Äôs epic dream sequences, and much more.

So throw on your favorite shabby sweater and roll on down for THE BIG LEBOWSKI Movie Party. It‚Äôll be far out.

show.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
show.headline: It all begins...with a choice

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: Eclipse</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Do us an extraordinary honor and say yes to this interactive screening
event.description:
Every choice has its consequences, some more than others. For example, if you choose to join us for another interactive TWILIGHT screening, the consequence will be you having an incredible time at the movies.

We‚Äôre back for another Movie Party in the perpetually cloudy town of Forks, and we think this one will ECLIPSE all the rest. Edward‚Äôs back in town and Bella has a few big decisions to make. Will she go for the muscled-up werewolf she‚Äôs known since they were kids, or the immortal 17-year-old asking for her hand in marriage? Either way, we‚Äôve got some themed props that you‚Äôre sure to imprint on, including custom-packaged hand warmers (in case you need to hide out on a snowy mountain), moon keychains, and Bella‚Äôs engagement ring (note: it will be a slightly less valuable recreation).

So book those seats before all the shows get filled with armies of newborns ‚Äì we promise we won‚Äôt steal your reason for existing.

Then don‚Äôt miss our exclusive Advance Screening of SASQUATCH SUNSET, the outrageous new film from David and Nathan Zellner. You‚Äôll laugh, you‚Äôll cry, and you‚Äôll be politely asked not to fling any poop if something startles you.

show.title: The Greasy Strangler
show.headline: A father and son who run a disco walking tour compete for a woman's attention

event.title: <show-title>The Greasy Strangler</show-title> <event-type-title>Benefit Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Help us get a greasy strangler back on his feet
event.description: Alamo Drafthouse was built on showcasing and celebrating outsider cinema from daring artists ‚Äì artists like Michael St. Michaels, a cult legend who could use some help right now. He‚Äôs on the mend from a recent hospital visit, but as we all know, those medical bills can be more slippery to deal with than a greased-up serial strangler. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre showing his outrageously odd comedy-slasher masterpiece, THE GREASY STRANGLER, with 100% of ticket revenue going to his GoFundMe. Michael's co-stars will be attending screenings in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Austin, and San Antonio and will be doing zoom Q&As in other markets. If you‚Äôre not able to make a screening but are still feeling particularly greasy, please consider contributing directly.

eventType.title: Benefit Screening
eventType.headline: Raising money for our communities one ticket at a time.
eventType.description: From time to time, we devote our screens to raising money for good causes. Each situation is a little different ‚Äì for more details, check out the individual show page.

event.description: Want a sneak peek of how the boy who would be king (of Hell) came to be? Then join us for a special Fantastic Fest Presents advance screening of THE FIRST OMEN with live Q&A. Writer/director Arkasha Stevenson will be joining us in person to chat about demons, Satanic motherhood, and whatever else strikes our fancy. Tickets are very limited, so we suggest you reserve yours ASAP. You know, unless you‚Äôd rather sell your soul to some unsavory entity to get one.

show.title: M√∫sica
show.headline: Face the music

event.title: <show-title>M√∫sica</show-title> <event-type-title>Free Victory Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Get a sneak peek inside a very musical mind
event.description:
Join us for an exclusive FREE advance screening of Prime Video and Rudy Mancuso‚Äôs imaginative new film, M√öSICA, a true-ish story. All you have to do to save your seat is purchase a fully refundable food and beverage voucher that you can redeem for snacks and non-alcoholic drinks at the show.

Based on writer, director, and star Rudy Mancuso, M√öSICA is a coming-of-age love story that follows an aspiring creator with synesthesia who must come to terms with an uncertain future while navigating the pressures of love, family, and his Brazilian culture in Newark, New Jersey.

eventType.title: Free Victory Screening
eventType.headline: Our way of saying thank you to our Victory Members
eventType.description: Calling all Victory Members! We‚Äôre saying thanks with a free screening. Just buy a food & beverage voucher to reserve your seat, and then use it toward food and drink at the show.

show.title: I'm "George Lucas": A Connor Ratliff Story
show.headline: The creator of "The George Lucas Talk Show" questions its need to continue

landscapeHeroImage.altText: I'M GEORGE LUCAS: A CONNOR RATLIFF STORY

portraitHeroImage.altText: I'M GEORGE LUCAS: A CONNOR RATLIFF STORY

posterImages.altText: I'M GEORGE LUCAS: A CONNOR RATLIFF STORY

event.title: <show-title>I'm "George Lucas": A Connor Ratliff Story</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Live Q&A with the crew
event.description: Save your seat for a special screening of I'M "GEORGE LUCAS": A CONNOR RATLIFF STORY, a documentary that follows the creator of "The George Lucas Talk Show" as he questions the need for the show to continue amidst the little financial and career gains it provides. Stick around after the screening for an in-person Q&A with director/producer Ryan Jacobi, producer Annamaria Sofillas, co-star Griffin Newman, co-producer/co-star Patrick Cotnoir, and the film's subject, Connor Ratliff, who will be joining virtually. Documentary filmmaker David Farrier (TICKLED) will moderate the 4/20 Q&A.

event.title: <show-title>Lousy Carter</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Get a sneak peek of Bob Byington's new film with live Q&A
event.description: Save your seat for a special advance screening of auteur writer/director Bob Byington‚Äôs latest film, LOUSY CARTER, with an exclusive Q&A. It‚Äôs a movie that holds a special place in our heart, both for being a slyly subversive and sardonic comedy and because it was filmed in part at our headquarters in Austin, TX. With that in mind, you can imagine how thrilled we are to have actor David Krumholtz joining us for a Q&A at the Manhattan screening and Bob Byington stopping by in LA. Whichever coast you‚Äôre on, you‚Äôll be getting a sneak peek of a fantastic new film with some insight from people we admire.

show.title: Labyrinth
show.headline: The beloved '80s puppet fantasy film

event.title: <show-title>Labyrinth</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Party, movie party all night long
event.description:
What could possibly be more magical than watching this iconic ‚Äò80s fantasy conjured by Jim Henson, George Lucas, and David Bowie at the peak of their powers on the big screen? Feeling it come truly alive at an interactive screening with fellow fans.

With themed props like shiny stress balls to roll around in your hand, masquerade masks, mini hands, and orange balloons, it‚Äôs the next best thing to Jareth the Goblin King actually showing up at your bedroom window.

show.title: The House of the Devil
show.headline: Talk on the phone. Finish your homework. Watch TV. DIE!

event.title: <show-title>The House of the Devil</show-title>
event.headline: Talk on the phone. Finish your homework. Watch TV. DIE!
event.description: Ti West‚Äôs THE HOUSE OF THE DEVIL very well may be the greatest horror film of its decade. The film is a slow-burning occult shocker, plotted with an emphasis on suspense and shot to recreate the glory days of ‚Äò80s horror. Where some throwback films feel plastic and phony (and, at their worst, self-parodying), THE HOUSE OF THE DEVIL hits the nail firmly on the head ‚Äì it works. West‚Äôs script and direction operate together to bring the characters to a boil, resulting in a third act that will paralyze you. Starring Jocelin Donahue (INSIDIOUS: CHAPTER TWO), Tom Noonan (THE MONSTER SQUAD), Mary Woronov (ROCK 'N' ROLL HIGH SCHOOL), AJ Bowen (YOU'RE NEXT), and a beautiful Greta Gerwig, just before she started to make it in Hollywood (in hip huggers!).

show.title: Mandy (2018)
show.headline: Nicolas Cage embarks on a psychotronic rampage for the ages

show.title: The Mask (1994)
show.headline: From zero to hero

event.title: <show-title>The Mask (1994)</show-title>
event.headline: ‚ÄúS-ssss-ssss-sssss-smokin'!‚Äù
event.description:
Men. YIKES. Throw a weird mask on a man? EVEN WORSE. Sorry. Let me start over. It‚Äôs part two of Queer Film Theory 101‚Äôs journey into the dark psyche of the '90s American male with the cartoonish and absurd 1994 classic THE MASK (all caps feel appropriate) staring one of our favorite fractured masculinity clowns, Jim Carrey, and featuring the amazing debut of Cameron Diaz. Just like a be-dragged Bugs Bunny seducing Elmer Fudd, THE MASK is surprisingly queer when you think about it. THE MASK is giving chaos bisexual by way of Tex Avery.

Stanly Ipkiss, a hapless bank employee and certified ‚Äúnice guy,‚Äù happens upon an ancient mask of indeterminant and likely problematically racist origin. When he pops it on his wormy little mug, he‚Äôs suddenly transformed into the uncomfortably horny anti-hero THE MASK! Is this new persona just the ticket that Stanley needs to assert himself and win the affection of the sultrily Jessica Rabbit-coded Tina? Or will the unbridled and violent masculinity of his new alter-ego cause him to lose everything‚Ä¶perhaps even his life?

Chuck Russell‚Äôs adaptation of Doug Mahnke and John Arcudi‚Äôs much darker Dark Horse Comic series became one of the top-grossing films of 1994. Due to the success of THE MASK, ACE VENTURA: PET DETECTIVE, and DUMB AND DUMBER (all released in 1994), Jim Carrey became a household name, and millions of children across the world became a little more annoying. C‚Äômon, you remember running around yelling, ‚ÄúSomebody stop me!‚Äù at anyone who would listen, right? What a nightmare. (Micheal Foulk)

event.title: <show-title>Monty Python and the Holy Grail</show-title> <event-type-title>Quote-Along Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Recite the sacred words with your favorite knights
event.description:
Greetings, old women, it is I, Arthur, your king!

Follow me into this special quote-along screening of our quest to seek the Holy Grail, but only if ye be men of valor. For the entrance to this screening is guarded by a creature so foul, so cruel that no man yet has fought with it and lived. Bones of full fifty men lie strewn about its lair. So, brave knights, if you do doubt your courage or your strength, come no further, for death awaits you all with nasty, big, pointy teeth.

Fear not, ye‚Äô will be equipped with themed props for the journey, including a mighty steed (coconuts) and a knightly weapon (inflatable sword) to take on all the animated monsters and Frenchmen on your path to glory.

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
Greetings, old women, it is I, Arthur, your king!

Follow me into this special quote-along screening of our quest to seek the Holy Grail, but only if ye be men of valor. For the entrance to this screening is guarded by a creature so foul, so cruel that no man yet has fought with it and lived. Bones of full fifty men lie strewn about its lair. So, brave knights, if you do doubt your courage or your strength, come no further, for death awaits you all with nasty, big, pointy teeth.

Fear not, ye‚Äô will be equipped with themed props for the journey, including a mighty steed (coconuts) and a knightly weapon (inflatable sword) to take on all the animated monsters and Frenchmen on your path to glory.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We‚Äôd love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.title: 2D Digital
formats.headline: Digital format projected using a digital projector.
formats.description: Digital format projected using a digital projector.

formats.title: 3D Digital
formats.headline: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!
formats.description: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!

formats.title: 35mm
formats.headline: Film print projected using film projectors.
formats.description: The industry standard for theatrical film releases prior to digital cinema. Film print projected using film projectors.

formats.title: Open Caption
formats.headline: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.
formats.description: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.

agePolicies.name: !!DO NOT USE!! All Ages
agePolicies.description: All ages will be allowed at all screenings of this show.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG-13 (Standard)
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG with Adult Focus
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated R
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
